intro: Dombeya sofiensis, commonly known as the Armenian dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or forested areas and is known for its ornamental value. Dombeya sofiensis is also valued for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
